title: Mulayam Singh Yadav to ride bicycle all alone in Bihar Assembly polls
content:
Unhappy with seats distribution, SP breaks coalition with Janta…  
By mukherjee saurav on September 3, 2015 at 6:35 PM Email 

Comments 

Lucknow, Sep 3: With Bihar Assembly election bells ringing round the streets, the recent rift between the Janta parivar and the allies had surprised most of the political parties nation-wide. Samajwadi Party chief Mulayam Singh Yadav — unhappy with the seats distribution — has decided to face Bihar polls all by himself. 

The cycle brand supremo made his views public after a detailed meeting with the party leaders at Lucknow on Thursday. Samajwadi Party spokesperson Ramgopal Yadav said at a press conference, “Our party has been humiliated in the coalition. So we have decided to contest the upcoming elections with dignity and respect.” (ALSO READ: Bihar Assembly Elections 2015: Asaduddin Owaisi and AIMIM – The dividing and uniting factor) 

Yadav was also seen making comments on the ongoing differences under the banner ‘Mahagatbandhan’ (Mega coalition). He alleged that neither from lantern (RJD) nor from arrow (JDU), any representative of Samajwadi Party was called for discussions on seats sharing. “We came to know about the number of seats allotted to us from the media. No one came to discuss with us. So we have decided to contest the elections all by ourselves. 

” 

However, JD(U) chief Sharad Yadav was seen confident on getting Mulayam Singh back into the coalition, considered a key ally in the ‘Mahagatbandhan 

’.
